column4: Ok, the only keyboard shortcut of mine that isn't working is "Run a terminal" can anyone help me out?
I've got that mapped to my 'menu key' which works fine - what key combo are you trying?
ive tried a bunch
Super_L (win key), F1, Shift-F1
odd, the win keys aren't assigned to anything by default, that should have worked
the same keys can be used for other shortcuts like web browser and email
just not terminal
I know, but by default in Ubuntu Gnome neither Windows key does anythign
i have my specific keyboard model selected so even my FN keys are wokring
nice - but I'm not sure why Super_L isn't working as assigned.. odd
but neither does F1, F2, F3 and so on
in other words, if I map the web browser shortcut to SUPER_L, it works... but if I map the terminal shortcut... it doesn't
very strange
can I edit shortcuts in gconf?
yes,
i've been looking for it but can't find it
start it from terminal w/ gconf-editor, or edit your menus to make it visible - Config Editor is hidden by default in dapper's menus
no i know where that it. i mean the keyboard shortcuts in gconf
no idea, I tend to avoid gconf... sorry
which fs is know for crashing?
reiser
so you agree that ext3 is good for my backups?
